intro: Scorzonera julia, commonly known as the Italian scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features a robust, tuberous root system that is often harvested for its edible qualities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and aromatic. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive dark center, blooming in late spring to early summer. Scorzonera julia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
